channel.title: AWS on Provision cloud resources using Kubernetes CRDs & Terraform
channel.description: Recent content in AWS on Provision cloud resources using Kubernetes CRDs & Terraform

item.title: AWS
item.description: AWS This guide will show you how to provision a AWS RDS (Relational Database Service) using Kubeform. Examples used in this guide can be found here. Look at the Terraform configuration below: provider "aws" { access_key = "ACCESS_KEY" region = "us-east-1" secret_key = "SECRET_KEY" } resource "aws_db_instance" "test1" { allocated_storage = 5 engine = "mysql" engine_version = "5.7" instance_class = "db.t2.micro" name = "mydb" parameter_group_name = "default.mysql5.7" password = "foobar1234" storage_type = "gp2" username = "foo" }‚èé This config creates an AWS RDS instance.
